fields.summary: Implement Exposure Management Rules in Carrier Admin

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software
status.name: BA Done

fields.description:
Create validation rules for the following fields:

* Zip code - "Property Zip will not rate. Correct or contact underwriting."
* Territory - "We are not currently writing in this Territory"
* County - "We are not currently writing in this County"

Validation rules use the ValidationLoopupService which query the below tables to determine if the field is valid for the ratebook. Therefore, the following tables must be populated with valid values:

* Zip code - TIVA_ZIPCODES
* Territory - TIVA_LISTROWS with "field" = "TERRITORY"
* County - Is this validation unprecedented? I am not seeing any existing functionality to check county within the validation rules, like there is for zip and territory. If so, We can include a check for valid counties directly in the validation rules file, or add valid counties to the tiva_listrows table.

fields.summary: Implement Exposure Management Rules in Carrier Admin

status.description: This status is managed internally by JIRA Software
status.name: BA Done

fields.description:
Right now, the BE will make a REST call whose response contains data relevant to the front end, but then returns only success or error message to the requester, rendering the important failure reasons lost. 

BE Needs to:
# Pass response data back to FE, so it can show capacity lock failure/success toasts effectively
# Upon failure, update the risk object with exposureerror[message]/field/level, and persist- this cannot be the FE's job.

Before the above is implemented, we need to determine if any other LOB's/applications are using the REST OPEN API for exposure management to determine if the change must be pushed in for FO only, or if the exposure mgmt service through the rest open API can be "fixed" to include the above functionality for all LOBs.

fields.summary: Implement Exposure Management Rules in Carrier Admin
fields.description:
As an agent I want the farmowners application I am entering to check for available capacity and reserve it .

*Tasks*
# Implement Exposure Management Rules in Carrier Admin.  Refer to requirement questionnaire on the wiki at:  https://focustech.atlassian.net/wiki/x/6YCuAg
# Add a rule in business validation to display the business message when capacity is not available (area is closed for new business)  and cannot be locked - Agreed to display this notification in a toast message instead of a business validation.

*Technical Task*
# Implement the Capacity API to call Capacity 
# Implement Carrier Admin Configuration needed for Exposure Management
# Add rule to business validations to display the capacity not available message
# Add fields to DB TIVA_FORISK for saving exp management

*Acceptance Criteria*
# Enter a new farmowners application in an area that is open for capacity.  Verify the capacity shows that is reserved (locked)
# Select an applicaiton where capacity is not reserved select the action option to reserve capacity.  Verify capacity is non-reserve (unlocked).

IF WE CANNOT RESERVE, the UI will display a message, such as ...

# ZIP CODE - We are currently not writing in this zip code
# TERRITORY - We are currently not writing in this Territory
# COUNTY - We are currently not writing in this County

Exposure Management Rules:

https://focustech.atlassian.net/wiki/display/proj/Farmowners+Point+of+Sale+Requirments?preview=/44990697/46236700/FarmownersExpMgmt_v1.0.docx

fields.summary: Add Binder Date Field to Database That Will Update When Application Submitted
fields.description:
When applications are bound-approved or bound-unapproved, we need to store the date and time this occurs.  This date will ultimately need to be printed on the Farmowner application.
In order to reflect this date and time we need to store this information in the Farmowner Database.

Tasks:
Add the binder date fields to DB (FO_RISK table) that will update when application is submitted. 3 fields:
BINDEREFFECTIVE
BINDEREXPIRE
BINDERISSUED
BINDERNUMBER

Acceptance criteria:
1. The effective date of the binder shall be displayed in the "BINDEREFFECTIVE" column in TiVA_FORISK.  The column type = "TIMESTMP".
2. The expiration date of the binder shall be displayed in the "BINDEREXPIRE" column in TiVA_FORISK.  The column type =  "TIMESTMP".
3. If the Binder was Issued, it must be reflected in the "BINDERISSUED" column,  Column type = "Decimal".
4. The binder number shall be displayed in the "BINDERNUMBER" column in TiVA_FORISK table.  The column type = VARCHAR.
